descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 3x3 grid with a number of colored blocks on a black background.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...the grid size is the multiple of the original grid times the number of colored squares.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...make the new grid size in black. Then move the grid colors to the new grid in the same relative spots. The colored areas will be the number of colored squares squared.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... single small fill.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... increase  by number of fill.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... make new fill square big by the number of original fill.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 3x3 with any number of colors
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...it get large enough to contain each color in more blocks
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...zoom out and give each block its on space

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...very interesting
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...good grid size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...output grid successfully solved

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...blocks of different colors
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is three times the width and three times the height of the input grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...fill each area of the output grid with the same color of the input grid
